description: very tiny view down a street of buildings with tile roofs
inscription: bottom center in pencil: F363 | on back in pencil: 363 / 371-B
portfolio: From Christmas Card Series #21, Miniature Series #29, Brooch Series #6, Mexican Series #2
provenance: John E. Andrus III (Wayzata, Minn.); Julie Andrus (Minneapolis, Minn.)
signed: below image in the plate (?): J Taylor Arms (?)
text: Pátzcuaro, a town located in the Mexican state of Michoacán, was settled more than 200 years before the arrival of the Spanish. When John Taylor Arms visited the town, the area had recently become a tourist mecca under the patronage of native son, Lázaro Cárdenas, Mexico’s president from 1934 to 1940. Even within the tiny confines of this miniature etching, the artist managed to evoke the town’s rich cultural past and beautiful terrain.
title: Pázcuaro, Michoacan, Mexico
